message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the circulatory system. Blood is directed around beneath the skin and bone by long passages, which refers to the network of blood vessels throughout the body. Option (A) is incorrect because a person is not directly involved in directing blood flow. Option (B) is incorrect because vision refers to sight and is not directly involved in blood circulation. Option (C) is incorrect because while thoughts can influence physiological responses, they do not directly control blood flow.
